text: As I grab my identification, I hold it up and stare at it in the one beacon of light that breaks through the darkness of the damp alleyway.
In my fingers lies an elegant card, with “Dick Johnson : PRIVATE INVESTIGATOR”, printed in platinum Proxima Nova on sleek matte black cardstock
Perfect.
I place the card flat on the table, the blackness of the card contrasting with the table like ink in a water glass.
I set my legs across my stand and light a smoke, waiting in quiet anticipation for my first client.
Just as I prepared to doze off, a figure emerged walking down the alleyway, silhouetting the dull morning sun like an eclipsing moon.
As they got closer, I was able to give em a good look.
It appeared to be a dame who resembled some sort of tall reptile.
She looked a bit more humanoid than the folk that had been giving me the side eye from across the alley.
YOU!

text: The stranger points at my fedora as if to insinuate it’s a cowboy hat, an opinion as wrong as wearing socks in sandals.
I take another smoke to alleviate this newfound stress.
As I stare at the billowing gray fumes I think to myself, “Maybe this isn’t worth it”
and once again look down to face this
lady’s outstretched finger..
I sigh and collect myself.
I need to make a good impression here if I want to expand my business, and more importantly I have a responsibility to help those in need.
There must be some sort of mistake. I only settled on this planet a few days ago; I haven’t received any jobs, let alone a reputation beyond “newcomer”.
